Package com.company.ems.model

Class Employee

java.lang.Object
com.company.ems.model.Employee
Direct Known Subclasses:
FullTimeEmployee, PartTimeEmployee
public abstract class Employee extends Object
Abstract class representing a generic employee in the Employee Management System (EMS). This class provides the common attributes and methods that are shared by all types of employees.

Subclasses of Employee must implement the following abstract methods:

  • clockIn() - to record when the employee starts working.
  • clockOut() - to record when the employee finishes working.
  • trackWorkHours() - to track the total hours worked by the employee.

It contains attributes like:

  • id - the unique identifier for the employee.
  • name - the full name of the employee.
  • department - the department the employee belongs to.
  • role - the role or position of the employee within the company.
  • workingHoursPerWeek - the number of hours the employee works per week.
  • salary - the salary of the employee.

Getter and setter methods are provided for all properties, allowing subclasses and external classes to retrieve and modify the state of an employee.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Michael Nwaeze

  • Method Details

    • clockIn

      public abstract void clockIn()
      Clock in the employee. This method should be implemented by subclasses to specify how the employee clocks in to start their work.

    • clockOut

      public abstract void clockOut()
      Clock out the employee. This method should be implemented by subclasses to specify how the employee clocks out after completing their work.

    • trackWorkHours

      public abstract void trackWorkHours()
      Track the work hours of the employee. This method should be implemented by subclasses to specify how the system tracks the number of hours worked by the employee.
